bibl.title: Letter from Neva Pauline Hough to Philip Showalter Hench, August 19, 1940

div1.p: Hough gives the date for the Lazear ceremony and also attaches information on his relationship with Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Neva Pauline Hough to Philip Showalter Hench, August 19, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
August 19, 1940

div1.p:
Your letter of August thirteenth has been
received and the enclosed check for two hundred
dollars has been deposited in a suspense account
pending Doctor Hutchison's decision as to how it
shall be used.

Doctor Hutchison is in New Hampshire and
does not plan to return to the office until about
the first of September. I note your inquiry re-
garding Lazear's official connection with this
College and have secured that information. Am at-
taching it herewith.

Our Founders' Day date is set for Saturday,
October twenty-sixth. However, as you probably know,
Yellow Jack is to be presented on Friday evening,
October twenty-fifth. I understand that the program
is rather indefinite at this time, but I am certain
the date will not be changed.

I shall bring your letter to Doctor Hutchison's
attention upon his return and you will hear from him
regarding final plans.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Neva Pauline Hough
Secretary Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
